page.title: 02 OLD BREEDS OF SHEEP
page.content: These are kept by Reverend Johnson, the vicar of Funtington and West Stoke. He has a{Dorset Horn}ram in the grounds of West Stoke Church and 8 { {Southdown }ewes and 2 lambs in the graveyard and paddock of Funtington Church and Vicarage. Southdown sheep are a small, compact breed weighing about 54.5kg. when fully grown. They roamed the South Downs 200 years ago. They graze the grass in the summer and are fed oats and hay during the winter. They are shorn in the early summer. Southdown fleeces are very white. They weigh about 1.36 kg. and have to be sold to the {Wool Marketing Board.}
